title: Computer-Based Medical Language Education Design: Strengthening Patient and Professional Communication Competencies (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology, teaching experience, and fundamental digital literacy (text and image editing capabilities)
context.additional_context: Participants have no or limited experience in designing medical professional education and possess beginner-level skills in utilizing computer-based educational tools. This course emphasizes clear language expression (simplification of medical terminology, visual aid utilization) and effective patient-doctor communication strategies required in medical settings.

learning_goals: Learners design patient education text and infographic content using CBT (educational software) based on medical scenarios
Learners develop interactive quiz modules (including medical terminology explanations) based on adult learning principles and medical communication guidelines
Learners produce multimedia patient education materials (medical terminology explanation videos/infographics) compatible with mobile devices and PCs
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
